roleset.name: practice
roleset.note: PRACTICE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'practice' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No verbnet entry. Comparison with 'play'. (from practice.01-v predicate notes)
PRACTISE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'practise' based on sentences in ectb2. Alternate spelling to 'practice'. (from practise.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: practice-v: odd kind of instrument
example.text: Yet even today, institutions are quietly practicing forms of portfolio insurance by nervously rushing to and fro in the markets.
example.arg: by nervously rushing to and fro in the markets

example.name: practice-v: more obvious instrument
example.text: John practices his scales on the harmonica.

example.name: practical-j
example.text: Felgenhauer predicted that actual troop deployments are unlikely to change much and believed the biggest practical effect of Russia's decision will be an end to mutual inspections and confidence-building measures governed by the Treaty

roleset.name: realistic, reasonable
roleset.note: PRACTICAL-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from practical.01-j)

example.name: practical-j: With it extraposition
example.text: So depending upon who the linguists you are bringing in are , it *EXP* may be possible / practical to get some real heavyweights to come in for their support ....
example.arg: to get some real heavyweights to come in for their support ....

example.name: practical-j: All args
example.text: I'd love to have a Camry, even to lease, but I picked the Toyota Corolla, because I figured it was more practical for me
